item.description:
The last Friday of the month is upon us once again, which means another Critical Mass ride. For those of you who don't know, critical mass is an unofficial celebration of bicycles and other non-motorized transportation. We ride through the streets of New Haven (about an hour or so) and end up at a house party or bar. The pace of the ride is slow and it's a lot of fun, with summer rides attracting around 75-100 people, and winter rides featuring 45-75 warmly-dressed cyclists!

so bring your bike down to the green at 5:45 this Friday and bundle up for November's Critical Mass! Meet at the flagpole by Church Street. The ride leaves at 6p (usually), so it pays to get there a bit early.

Reflective clothing, blinky lights, and a great attitude are a must! Helmet-head is the latest fashion...celebrate life, wear a helmet!

Eric is your contact this month.
item.name: November Critical Mass Bicycle Ride, 5:45p Friday 11-30
